subject: p10402372
History: Known bronchiectasis and pseudomonas colonization, now hypoxia and cough with fevers. Assessment.
Findings: As compared to the previous radiograph, there is a subtle but new opacity at the right lung base, in the medial aspect of the lung. The opacities located in an area of bronchiectasis. Given the clinical presentation, pneumonia must be suspected. The referring physician,. Was paged for notification at the time of dictation, 3:18 pm. On and the findings were discussed over the telephone. Otherwise, the radiograph is unchanged, extensive overinflation with bronchiectasis but no pleural effusions or other parenchymal changes. Normal size of the cardiac silhouette. Unchanged position of the nasogastric tube.
